meanings.definition: Cut back (a tree or shrub) to ground level to stimulate new growth.
meanings.sent1: The gardener coppiced the tree to help it grow better.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often coppice trees to encourage them to grow thicker and stronger.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tree go to the barber? To get coppiced!
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting fresh can be like coppicing a tree, cutting back to grow anew.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the axe on the tree echoed through the forest as it was coppiced.

meanings.definition: A tree or shrub that has been cut back to ground level to stimulate new growth.
meanings.sent1: The coppiced tree in the garden looked much healthier after the pruning.
meanings.sent2: In the park, you can see many coppiced trees that have been carefully maintained.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel made a home in the hollow of the coppiced shrub.
meanings.sent4: The coppiced tree stood like a proud soldier, regrowing after being cut down.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with the scent of fresh growth from the coppiced shrubs.
